page.title: 11MEDIA Newspaper 2
page.content: witnessed a decline in business, especially in commercial trade in the town. Many shops in the High Street have closed down and premises stand vacant.There is talk of some of the properties being converted into office space; but this has not been confirmed. The crime rate is low, in line with most wealthy areas. The paper receives information on crime from the headquarters of crime prevention in Watford. Current important issues concern plans for the alteration of the Three Rivers District Council boundaries, following the completion of the M25 nearby. This would effectively remove Chorleywood from the Council's control. The proposed closure of the main line train service between Marylebone and Aylesbury would result in a depleted commuter service.
